title: cannot send emails
content: I can receive emails but cannot send them I get a message that says the outgoing server (SMTP) hacksaw-mail.internode.on.net failed Please check your Outgoing server SMTP settings Could you please assist in providing the correct settings so I can check Thankyou Warwick Hack
creator: hacksaw1

title: I need to change the email password on one of my POP accounts.  When I got to saved passwords, the passwords for this account were not there.  It contained only the passwords for the second account
content: Tell me what to do, given this surprising finding, to change the password for the account. (windows)
creator: spinach23

title: Thunderbird update interrupted - unable to load or uninstall
content: A recent Thunderbird update (auto update) must've been interrupted, because I keep getting a "Reboot your computer to complete the update" message. I have rebooted many times with no change. I tried to uninstall Thunderbird, but get the same message. I also tried to reinstall it, but no change. The Thunderbird icon has also changed to a computer with a disk in the front. Any ideas??
creator: bronman

title: Comcast issues
content: Please help me. I've been with Thunderbird for many years and now I have nothing but problems. I've attempted to change settings and I'm thinking that possibly I've screwed it all up. I've changed the passwords through Comcast a few times but it seems to also be screwed up. I've been with Thunderbird for a long time and donated 3 times this past year. Now I have constant problems signing in with the same old password so I've contacted Comcast to change the passwords. Is there anywhere on Thunderbird where I can check to see what passwords are still listed for me? I have 4 email addresses. SillySam, LatonHigh, Kissincousin and TahoeDocTom all with Comcast.net I'm desperate to get back online with my emails.
creator: sillysam

title: Clarify threaded messages display and the "Toggle message threads" option.
content:
I moved several messages to a folder called "Teamskeet", but when I opened that folder it didn't display any messages.*** Through tiral-and-error I discovered that the "Toggle message threads" option would show me the messages in that folder. 

  The upoaded image display is annotated to explain my question better. Specifically, are the messages that are displayed ONLY the ones in that folder that are threaded? And what does it mean that 15 messages are selected. I didn't knowingly select any  messages.

*** Initially, it didn't show any messages, but after I closed and re-opened TB it did show the messages in that folder. I'll be doing some troubleshooting to re-create that scenario.

Thanks for your help, SweetTasha
creator: sweettasha

title: Message filter from one email account to another deletes body of text when received in second email account.
content:
Hi, I use Thunderbird as an email client from Office 365. Thunderbird requires OWL to work with 365 and it is installed and working.

I have an email account associated with my website. "Sales@" Thunderbird filters the message on arrival and sends it to "Paul@" When receiving into "Paul@" the body of the email is blank. (only certain emails. not all). This has only just begun in the past 2 weeks. Because the message is moved in Thunderbird, there isn't a copy of it in 365.

Please see Attached image of errors from Ctrl+Shift+J.

Thanks, Paul.
creator: paul646

title: Weird Folder with Chinese Characters After Thunderbird Update
content:
I have Nebula 128.2.0esr (64-bit) for Windows 10.

On the same day of my last Thunderbird update, a mysterious folder appeared in the root of my C-drive with Chinese (?) characters.

The Folder name is: u馐㕈ʶ

(See the screenshots below.)

Inside the folder appears two items:

A Subfolder called: IDB and a file called: .metadata-v2

Inside the IDB Folder, I see these things:

Folder: 3647222921wleabcEoxlt-eengsairo.files and these files: 3647222921wleabcEoxlt-eengsairo.sqlite 3647222921wleabcEoxlt-eengsairo.sqlite-shm 3647222921wleabcEoxlt-eengsairo.sqlite-wal

Inside this folder: 3647222921wleabcEoxlt-eengsairo.files I see:

a folder called: journals and a file named 21 and 22

Inside the journals folder is empty.

Does anyone have ANY idea what this Chinese Character folder is?

Googling it, I see that it could have something to do with Firefox, but I don't use Firefox much and this folder appeared on the same day my Thunderbird updated.

Trendmicro Housecall, Windows Defender, HP Wolf Security -- NONE of them flagged these as suspicious, but I just don't like this mysterious folder on my C-Drive and wonder where it came from and what function it serves.

Thank you!
creator: ThunderbirdAhead
